distribution: Occurs in the lower Amazon river basin with specific records from the Xingu and Tocantins tributary drainages.
normani: named for John Roxbrough Norman (1898-1944).

Acnodon: from the Ancient Greek α- (a-), meaning ‘lacking’, and κνώδων (knodon), meaning ‘projecting teeth on the blade of a hunting spear'; probably based on the misimpression that the type species, A. oligancanthus, has no predorsal spine.
habitat: Acnodon: from the Ancient Greek α- (a-), meaning ‘lacking’, and κνώδων (knodon), meaning ‘projecting teeth on the blade of a hunting spear'; probably based on the misimpression that the type species, A. oligancanthus, has no predorsal spine.
normani: named for John Roxbrough Norman (1898-1944).
Occurs in the lower Amazon river basin with specific records from the Xingu and Tocantins tributary drainages.
Type locality is ‘ Rio Santa Teresa, a western tributary of upper Rio Tocantins, Goiaz State, Brazil’, referring to what is now known as Goiás state, central Brazil.
reproduction: Acnodon: from the Ancient Greek α- (a-), meaning ‘lacking’, and κνώδων (knodon), meaning ‘projecting teeth on the blade of a hunting spear'; probably based on the misimpression that the type species, A. oligancanthus, has no predorsal spine.
normani: named for John Roxbrough Norman (1898-1944).
Occurs in the lower Amazon river basin with specific records from the Xingu and Tocantins tributary drainages.
Type locality is ‘ Rio Santa Teresa, a western tributary of upper Rio Tocantins, Goiaz State, Brazil’, referring to what is now known as Goiás state, central Brazil.
An aquarium with base dimensions of 120 ∗ 45 cm should be the smallest considered.
